meanings.definition: Of, involving, or absorbed in meditation.
meanings.sent1: The quiet room provided a meditative atmosphere for relaxation.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the meditative practice of yoga every morning.
meanings.sent3: His cat took a meditative stance while staring at a bug on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The slow, rhythmic sound of the waves was meditative to her ears.
meanings.sent5: The meditative state of mind helped her focus and find inner peace.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or conducive to meditation.
meanings.sent1: The soft music created a meditative mood in the room.
meanings.sent2: The garden was a meditative space for quiet reflection.
meanings.sent3: The meditative garden gnome seemed lost in deep thought.
meanings.sent4: The flickering candlelight cast a meditative glow on the walls.
meanings.sent5: The meditative ambiance of the temple calmed her restless mind.

meanings.definition: Given to contemplation or deep thought.
meanings.sent1: His meditative expression hinted at his pondering nature.
meanings.sent2: The old man had a meditative look as he gazed out the window.
meanings.sent3: The meditative squirrel seemed to be contemplating its next acorn heist.
meanings.sent4: The meditative silence of the library allowed her thoughts to roam freely.
meanings.sent5: The meditative philosopher often lost track of time in his musings.
